subjects.subject: Algebra
subjects.description: The manipulation of equations and isolation of variables. The foundation of all higher-level math.

subjects.subject: College Algebra
subjects.description: Builds more on top of your algebraic foundations adding things like logarithms and rational equations.

subjects.subject: Trigonometry
subjects.description: The study of the relationships between the sides of a triangle and the triangle's angles.

subjects.subject: Precalculus
subjects.description: A combination of college algebra and trigonometry. Needed as a foundation for learnign Calculus.

subjects.subject: Calculus 1
subjects.description: Differential Calculus: Includes basic concepts like limits, differetniation, and rate of change. Also starts integral calculus.

subjects.subject: Calculus 2
subjects.description: Continue building your calculus knowledge learning now about integration techniques, series, and the calculus of parametric and polar functions.

subjects.subject: Calculus 3
subjects.description: The Calculus of Multiple Variables including directional derivatives, partial derivates, multiple integration, and more.

subjects.subject: Differential Equations
subjects.description: Sometimes called calculus 4, it solves equations about the derivatives of unknown functions. It is used all the time in topics like physics.

subjects.subject: Linear Algebra
subjects.description: The algebra of matrices, linear systems, linear transformations, and vector spaces. May require some calculus to understand some concepts.

subjects.subject: Statistics
subjects.description: Make educated pridictions about what may happen learning about r, r-squared, LSRL, and more
